name: Planning: Regulatory Compliance Audit Workflow
description: A workflow that automates the "Planning" phase of regulatory compliance audits by mapping requirements to risks and controls, incorporating external intelligence, and generating document request lists.

data.label: Ingest Regulatory and Policy Data
data.description: Collect and process complex regulatory texts (PCAOB, OCC, FRB) and internal company policies.
data.instructions: Upload or provide links to the specific regulatory documents and internal policies relevant to this audit. The system will ingest these for comparative analysis.

data.label: External Intelligence Scanning
data.description: Scan enforcement actions and industry news to identify high-risk requirements.
data.instructions: Analyze external intelligence sources to flag requirements where organizations have historically struggled or where regulators are currently focusing their enforcement efforts.

data.label: Automated RCM Generation
data.description: Map regulatory requirements directly to risks and controls using IIA best practices.
data.instructions: Using the ingested data and intelligence flags, generate a Risk Control Matrix (RCM) that maps each regulatory requirement to its corresponding risk and internal control.

data.label: Generate Tailored DRL
data.description: Generate a preliminary document request list based on the identified controls.
data.instructions: Create a tailored Document Request List (DRL) that specifies the evidence needed to test the controls identified in the RCM.

data.label: Export Final Audit Plan
data.description: Finalize and export the audit plan in formats like JSON or Excel.
data.instructions: Review the generated RCM and DRL. Export the final audit planning package to your preferred format (JSON for GRC systems or Excel for manual tracking).
